availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Gaylord McFall (Richland County, Ohio, merchant and soldier)

body.p: Richland County, Ohio, merchant and soldier. Ohio native. Son of Hugh McFall and Clarissa McFall. Merchant in Madison, Ohio in 1850. Merchant in Mansfield, Ohio in 1860. Served in the McLaughinâ€™s Squadron Ohio Cavalry (U.S.A). as captain and major in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Richland County, Madison, p. 122B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Ohio, Richland County, Mansfield, Ward 1, p. 23.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Ohio, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M552, Roll 71.
Find A Grave, "Maj Gaylord McFall (1829-1898)," Memorial #124764554, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/124764554# (accessed November 19, 2018).
